website_summaries.verdict: Versatile backpack is really two packs in one!
pros: No need to choose between a smaller or larger pack, this one has both
It can hold loads up to 50 pounds
cons: The big pack is too big to use as a carry-on while flying

customer_reviews.title: Not as sturdy as you'd think.
customer_reviews.text: I was super excited about this backpack. Me and my wife bought this for our honeymoon trip backpacking through SE Asia. They looked great, we got them several months in advance and were very excited. I detached the detachable daypack for the plane ride there, and we sent the bag as baggage on the plane... When I tried re-attaching the day-pack upon arrival, I heard a crack and the zipper had broken on our FIRST DAY. This was extremely upsetting and disappointing, especially after all the great reviews and comments about this product.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable and well designed 2 piece backpack.
customer_reviews.text: This is our second Osprey backpack. The smaller detachable backpack is ingenious and easily detaches from the large one. It’s perfect for day hikes, shopping or shorter excursions. Overall, it’s a great 2-piece set and worth every penny. It’s durable and comfortable and can easily withstand the rigors of long treks and trips. The shoulder and waist straps are comfortable and fit snugly. After 2 international trips, our 1st Osprey still looks almost new. Our second one just returned from 3 weeks abroad and looks like it just came out of the box.
customer_reviews.author: T. Trevelyan

customer_reviews.title: Awesome bag system for international travel
customer_reviews.text: Awesome bag system for international travel. Works great in all of its configurations. Yes, it's about 1" taller than some airline guidelines but we were able to make it fit in all bag sizers for United, Aer Lingus, and Eurowongs without issue.
customer_reviews.author: DJV

customer_reviews.title: Very collapsible...maybe too much
customer_reviews.text: I love Opsrey bags in general, this is my 4th or 5th...but this is my least favorite. I like that it has the break off back pack for day trips and such. But I do not like the bag layout for the main compartment, no pockets or support so you really have to take almost everything out if your searching for something. The top "Flap" doesnt fold all the way down so it leaves you with about 1' or so that your hand is really moving things around in order to search. Material is awesome and of course it looks great. Thats my only gripe.
customer_reviews.author: CMo

customer_reviews.title: ALMOST carry-on size
customer_reviews.text: Love the daypack, its "good enough" to protect a 12-inch screen notebook AND an eight inch tablet. The main pack is just one large compartment so some packing cubes or similar are needed. Mesh on the main compartment "flap" is a nice touch, great for sock or undies. I've never used the daypack attached to the main pack so can't comment on that. Main pack does fit on airline and train overheads based on my testing but caution is advised on when flying on smaller, single isle aircraft...I don't think it will fit overhead on most of those planes. Zippers are good quality, pack is impressive for the price paid.
customer_reviews.author: John Biccum

customer_reviews.title: Solid travel pack
customer_reviews.text: Brilliant combination of rugged build quality and refined looks. It works for camping - I took it on a 5 day backpacking trip in the Ozarks, and it was quite functional for that. The suspension system is actually quite impressive for a pack mostly made for air travel. If you're looking for a camping pack, find something with a bit more options for attachment points... but for the city, and travel in general, nothing beats it. The red's not a bad color choice either - stands out in the wilderness (or at the airport luggage carousel), but not too bright or obnoxious in the city.
customer_reviews.author: Isaiah Felton

customer_reviews.title: Great bag but watch out if you expect it to fit like the Farpoint 40 M/L
customer_reviews.text: I'm deciding between the Osprey Fairpoint and Osprey Porter. I had tried on a friend's Farpoint 40 M/L and it fit me so great. Even with heavy load i was comfortable. So i decided to try a Farpoint 55, thinking the frame would be the same, but it's not - in the M/L it's WAY too big on me. I hope the S/M fits or I will be bummed! You can fit a ton of stuff in the large compartment (and if you don't use packing cubes you'll love the compression straps. I wish there was a bit more organization on the small day pack. it's pretty much just one pocket. Maybe another stash pocket on the outside?
customer_reviews.author: theredheadsaid

customer_reviews.title: Worth every penny
customer_reviews.text: This was exactly what I was looking for, and was great for a 2 1/2 week backpacking trip in Nicaragua. The bag is very comfortable to wear, and extremely durable. The daypack is the perfect size, and the main bag had more than enough space for 2 weeks of clothes + hiking shoes / snorkel / essentials. Also fits perfectly in the overhead storage compartments on airplanes and even the chicken buses in Nica. I'm not sure if the L size will fit since it's a little longer, because I have the S model. Fits me perfectly (I'm 5'8)
customer_reviews.author: El Nino

customer_reviews.title: Excellent and recommend to everyone who travels.
customer_reviews.text: Amazing bag with very durable construction and easy to clean materials. Made travel through airports much easier since our hands were free for passports, forms, calling agents, and navigating through crowded terminals. Great support with adjustments to ensure good center of gravity. Large sippers are easily locked. This was MORE than enough space for a 2 week trip to Thailand with day clothes, beach clothes, and dress clothes for night, but we also used vacuum bags "12 pack PREMIUM Travel Space Saver Bags. No Vacuum Needed" and this helped organize our clothes, keep dirty or wet clothes from ruining our clean clothes, and ensuring that if it rained our stuff wouldn't get wet.
customer_reviews.author: JC 25

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for travelers
customer_reviews.text: Pros -Opens all the way so you can organize and get to your stuff easily (highly recommended picking cubed) -Durable -zip off day pack is spectacular -you can lock the entire bag with one bag lock -zippers are concealed when fully locked...makes theft more challenging -Fits well for people of all hight (I'm 5'2, and a friend who is 6'4 also has this pack) Cons -weight distribution is hard because of how far from your body the small pack sits -Water bottle pockets are completely unusable - large pack doesn't have a laptop compartment -because of the zip off bag the shape is odd when fully packed... doesn't always fit in overhead bins
customer_reviews.author: Julie B.

customer_reviews.title: Great carry on and personal item
customer_reviews.text: When separated you can use the 40L pack as your carry on and the 15L backpack as your personal item. This is the best travel bag if you don't like hauling around a roller bag. My wife got the Fairview which is a little shorter and wider giving it more clearance in overhead storage on a flight. Our most recent trip we were able to stack the 40L packs on top of each other with our 15L backpack under the seat in front of us. Favorite bag I've purchased in the past 10 years of travel.
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Well made and comfortable
customer_reviews.text: This is a nice pack. It's lightweight, but solidly built. I like the versatility of using it as a bag or back pack. I look forward to seeing how the pack does after a few flights and dealing with airport security and baggage handlers. I haven't needed Osprey's warranty, hope I don't need it, but have read great things about their customer service. The bag has plenty of room and is very comfortable on my shoulders even with a heavy load.
customer_reviews.author: Beerfish

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal travel backpack
customer_reviews.text: Highly recommend this backpack. Traveled with it for 12 days. Fit everything I needed on the way, as well as a few extra items I brought back. Even when I thought I put too much in, it molded in place effortlessly. It is made of sturdy material and held up well from place to place. The daypack came in handy, and easily zips back on the main pack. The straps to hold everything in place (and to your back) were perfectly situated. Would not change a thing on the layout. Zippers worked well with two small locks I purchased. If looking for a backpack to use in fast-paced travel for good amounts of time, this is it.
customer_reviews.author: oioi123

customer_reviews.title: Buy it you won't regret it!
customer_reviews.text: 🥰I love this pack. It sat on my wish list for months and now that I have it I can guarantee other travelers will be just as pleased as I am. I got the M/L and haven't been harrased at the gate for it's size if you're worried about that. I have many backpacks and the fact that this one has the detachable daypack made things super convenient. I will be buying another for my son.
customer_reviews.author: Jessica

customer_reviews.title: More bear bones than Osprey’s older bags and a bit too long for some flights overhead bins
customer_reviews.text: I bought this because I had bought my wife a similar pack from osprey years earlier. Unfortunately this bag is not as well designed as it used to be. Fairly basic on the sub pockets. Almost seems like osprey was trying to make a bear bones dual bag. On the bright side the cost is relatively low. Be warned, that the 55 may not fit as a carry on for many carriers due to its length exceeding an overhead storage bin.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher M.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality! Slightly bulky though, if that would bother you.
customer_reviews.text: I used this backpack for 50 days while backpacking Europe; packing and unpacking it daily, zipping and unzipping, adjusting, and taking off/putting on multiple times per day and it held up beyond expectation. Never an issue with a zipper or seam! The day pack, however, made the bag rather bulky and difficult to travel on metros/in crowded areas with. I loved having it, but next time I think I'd rather have a regular large backpack and carry a small collapsible backpack inside for when I need a day pack. Overall, however, from a quality standpoint I would definitely recommend it.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah

customer_reviews.title: Great product - no tie down config's for externally lashing a sleeping bag....weird!
customer_reviews.text: I like everything about this product....except one feature - - that is missing! Compared to other brands and total versatility, this pack has no convenient way - or patches/loops - to secure (externally) a sleeping bag! Whaaattt?? Mine is synthetic and will not easily compact in the main compartment, so I have to figure an elaborate way to lash the bag to the top or bottom - without secure ways to do that. However...an amazing design in every other way!
customer_reviews.author: Lenzerini

customer_reviews.title: Phenomenal quality
customer_reviews.text: This 55 pound travel bag has saved me from waiting in the airport for hours. The detachable front backpack has been very convenient for when I have to travel to the market or through the cities when I travel. The life time warranty is another perk to this amazing brand. I have never felt so happy with a bag for the amount of time I been traveling since I bought it shows that the quality of the product is worth buying.
customer_reviews.author: Israel

customer_reviews.title: CANT RECOMMEND ENOUGH
customer_reviews.text: I took this pack on a 24 day trip in Europe. Let me tell you, I will never use a suitcase ever again! I absolutely recommend this backpack to anyone thinking of traveling with a back pack. The main backpack fit in the overhead with ease and the small day pack is PERFECT for every day use. I absolutely love this backpack so much!
customer_reviews.author: Jacob

customer_reviews.title: Best travel backpack
customer_reviews.text: I had previously bought the large size and I love it. There is the chance on international flights that the large has to be checked. I've never had to check it but, it wouldn't be a problem, the straps zip up nice and there is a detachable day pack. The small is about 2 inches shorter, and meets carry-on requirements. So yes. I have 2 of these packs now and love them both.
customer_reviews.author: TheCatDidIt

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel bag at a great price
customer_reviews.text: I got this for an amazing price on amazon for 121 USD on Nov 1 2018. It was shipped from England to the US in a few days! The bag is perfect: - good amount of storage for light traveling - a smaller day pack that attaches/detaches easily - easy access to the storage through thoughtful zipper placements
customer_reviews.author: Hooles

customer_reviews.title: I love the detachable mini backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack! I used it for my 2 week trip to the Phillippines. I love that it unzips around the front because it makes it easy to see what you have and find what you need. Most other bags I've seen unzip at the top and then you have to dig for your stuff. It's durable and water-resistant, but the best part is the mini detachable backpack! It's like a 2 in 1! Leave the large part at home base and wear the smaller one on your daily adventures. Highly recommended
customer_reviews.author: Tina L.

customer_reviews.title: Perfect size. Used as Carry on and Personal item ...
customer_reviews.text: Traveled to Australia through Jetstar with this bag. Perfect size. Used as Carry on and Personal item in US and first legs of Australian flights. The LAST Jetstar flight out, they weighed my bag and it was overweight so I had to check it (US$140!). As long as you stay under weight, this bag is great. Plenty of room, comfortable to wear, and great day pack for wondering the country during the day.
customer_reviews.author: Joshua S.

customer_reviews.title: This bag is awesome. The extra day/laptop bag was perfect for my ...
customer_reviews.text: This bag is awesome. The extra day/laptop bag was perfect for my laptop, camera, raincoat and extra things I needed. I did 800 miles in southeast Asia with it. I was also able to take it on as a carry on. I'm 6'3" and wore it on the plane. Might not be 'legal size,' for a carry on, but I had no problem getting it on with both bags (not connected). The large bag fit in all overheads and the small bag under the seat. Zippers are supper solid. Big bag held my shoes, sandals, 1 pants, 2 shorts, 6n shirts and toiletry bag with ease.
customer_reviews.author: garlar

customer_reviews.title: Love this Bag
customer_reviews.text: I have been using this bag on and off for about 2 years now. Longest trip it's been in is 7 months. I am 5'1 and got the woman's small. I can pack so much in this and still have room for gifts (if you pack it right), which is also a downfall when you have weight restrictions for carry-ons. I like the detachable day pack which I used as my carry-on. The mesh on the day pack has begun to run from a lot of use and stuffing things in it but still holding up nicely. I would def recommend!
customer_reviews.author: Desiree Lopez

customer_reviews.title: The day pack was perfect for carrying my passports and computer with me
customer_reviews.text: I took this pack for a trip to Portugal and it was phenomenal. I would say it fits clothes for 1 week very well. We were gone 2 weeks and I washed some of my clothing half way through. I took it on as carry on on the way out and due to a few items purchased we checked the bags on the way back. The day pack was perfect for carrying my passports and computer with me. When checking the bag I did notice some where on the bag where the cover was over the backpack straps.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: ... backpack for our trip to Europe and it was awesome. I was able to use it as a ...
customer_reviews.text: I got this backpack for our trip to Europe and it was awesome. I was able to use it as a carry on and keep the zip on book bag as a second personal item. I didn't have any problems flying in the United States, Ireland, or Paris. I definitely recommend getting packing cubes to go inside. I was able to fit enough clothes for 17 days, 2 pairs of shoes, and my slimmed down toiletries. Now in the states when I travel this is my go-to bag. I usually just use the main bag and leave the small book bag home. It's been such a great purchase!
customer_reviews.author: OptimusPrime0725

customer_reviews.title: Great! Highly recommended.
customer_reviews.text: I went to Europe from USA with this backpack as carry on and the small one as the personal item. Never had a problem with TSA, just make sure you are from the first persons getting in the plane. Fit better in the center rows compartments, uncomfortable on the sides. But everything else is great. A lot of space, practical, good quality, strong material. I love it. Buy it, use it.
customer_reviews.author: CATorresCotty

customer_reviews.title: Carries a lot, flies well
customer_reviews.text: It is a little bit difficult to take stuff out, so if you're constantly opening and closing your kit I'd recommend another. However, for travelling on the long term this was perfect. The clean cut design keeps it from getting caught on seats or railings; the big bag works well as a duffel bag and the smaller backpack is an outstanding daypack. Glad I bought it and I look forward to using it more and more. Update: After doing a bit of flying between the US, Canada, and Asia, I have never had a problem getting around with this as my carry-on. I even strapped a Ukelele case on it once and nobody noticed.
customer_reviews.author: Henry

customer_reviews.title: Great Bag! Fits in almost every overhead.
customer_reviews.text: I've probably been on 50 flights with this bag. I've only had to check it 2 times. I've walked 1-2 miles with the bag full (10-12KG) and strapped on my back. After that it becomes uncomfortable. PRO'S It's simple, light-ish, easy to lock, versatile, durable and comfortable. Way easier than wheeling your luggage up stairs at older and smaller isolated airports. ;) CON'S Not fashionable, hurts your back long distance (all packs do) and has not pouch for a water bottle. Yeah seriously no water bottle holder. Those net pouches on the back don't hold even 20oz bottles.
customer_reviews.author: chris_DDF

customer_reviews.title: The maiden voyage.
customer_reviews.text: So far so good, all my work and personal stuff for 1 week in LA fit including 13" laptop, clothes, electronics, etc. I wish there were more pockets in the main compartment like they have in the 46l, but the Daypck was the selling point. The bag met the bag limits and fit in the overhead compartment. So for the maiden voyage it has done well so far.
customer_reviews.author: Sam

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Exactly what I was looking for - carry on and backpack in one. UPDATE after traveling to Haiti with this bag. Its even better than I could have hoped for! the ability to load the main pack like a suitcase and detach the daypack as my personal item made traveling so easy. This bag is great for week+ longer trips. If you are smaller statured, definitely get the S/M size. It fit perfectly in the carryon measurement and was a breeze to carry even off my back.
customer_reviews.author: rm3256

customer_reviews.title: Worth Every Penny
customer_reviews.text: This thing has been on 3 continents, on deployments, and backpacking through Europe and South America. It is awesome. So awesome, someone stole it out of my car one night. I didn't want to buy another one, but I had to. They are that good. #keepyourhandsoffmysack
customer_reviews.author: Brian Baker

customer_reviews.title: Doesn't work well for me
customer_reviews.text: Very disappointed in product. After all reviews I thought this would be perfect for my European trip. Not functional without. attached pack and awkward with pack attached.
customer_reviews.author: Watters in Wyoming

customer_reviews.title: Amazing!!!! 10 stars!!
customer_reviews.text: Amazing!!!! I’m so happy that I bought this backpack! Money well invested for sure. It’s top quality, made to last. They thought about every detail. And I LOVE that I can detach the small backpack, so convenient!! Another great feature is that you can zip the handles in the back so it’s easier to check in and keep all the pieces safe.
customer_reviews.author: Mayara

customer_reviews.title: Damaged
customer_reviews.text: Bought three bags, one for me and two for my friends traveling with me to Philippines. Theirs look great, but mine was damaged during shipping (I’m assuming?) cuz as you can see from the pictures, mine is bowed out rather than in. It makes carrying it a bit awkward, doesn’t feel as comfortable as my friend’s bag. I didn’t notice it until I started packing for the trip and now I don’t know what to do. I need the bag for the trip and I leave tomorrow. For as expensive as the bag is I’m disappointed. I’m hoping something can be worked out when I get back. One of the reasons I bought Osprey is their amazing warranty.
customer_reviews.author: Tenzin Tarzan

customer_reviews.title: light, manageable
customer_reviews.text: I purchased this to replace my old, much heavier backpack. This holds less, but I've learned to pack light after a few trips, so it's fine. Enough "nooks & crannies" to organize contents. (I also use mesh packing cubes) Narrower and less bulky, it's easier to maneuver on a bus or train. Day pack is a good size, and handily stowed. Has a zip cover for the harness, which is preferred for plane travel. Seems sturdy and durable - will let you know after a few more trips!
customer_reviews.author: LoveNH

customer_reviews.title: ... linking the 2 packs failed after 2 weeks of EASY use. The most common failure in a pack ...
customer_reviews.text: The zipper linking the 2 packs failed after 2 weeks of EASY use. The most common failure in a pack or a bag and they used a small, weak zipper. Not sure what all the hubub about Osprey is after owning and returning 2 bad packs to them.
customer_reviews.author: Matt

customer_reviews.title: Good cabin baggage size
customer_reviews.text: This is a 40+15 L backpack. I was able to easily carry it on as cabin baggage in a United and a Viva Aerobus flight without any hassle. The 40 L fits in the overhead compartment while the 15 L fits under the seat.
customer_reviews.author: random

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: The Osprey is a great alternative to a suitcase when combining airline travel and adventuring. I usually disconnect the removable pack to use as a personal item and the main pack fits fine in overhead bins. Plus, the zip-off pack works great for day trips while leaving the big pack at the hotel
customer_reviews.author: Mike Foote

customer_reviews.title: Awesome
customer_reviews.text: Traveled around the world with this. No issues taking this in turkish airlines as a carry on. Going and coming back. Very very durable. Not enough pockets but i would buy packing cubes or packing bags for hiking if that is a concern. Great great bag
customer_reviews.author: Sallo

customer_reviews.title: Comfortable
customer_reviews.text: Ive had this back pack for a very long time now and finally came around to write a review about it. The backpack was designed perfectly for me. im 6'2, 205 lbs. The backpack straddles my body when I have everything on it. Its comfortable, which is important when going back packing. Ive done snow camping, back pack Europe with it and it still looks brand new. I would recommend this to anybody who likes a comfortable back pack. OH!.. I also have a lower back injury and this did not aggrevate it one bit. Cheers!
customer_reviews.author: John Le

customer_reviews.title: BUY IT NOW!
customer_reviews.text: One of the best things I’ve ever bought in my whole life! Easy to pack n get in n out of Definitely buy packing cubes I was able to fit: 3 pairs of shoes Makeup n hair brush Two weeks worth of clothes All pertinent travel info items, money cards-plus a small clutch for Dinner Carried it from the alps to Florence,cinque terre, Pisa, and Venice More amazing buys..... •chilly towel •vapur water bottle with clip •mini double sided caribiner clips for all the double zippers to protect from thieves
customer_reviews.author: ERG

customer_reviews.title: Best Bag Ever! Oh, I wish I could travel !
customer_reviews.text: This bag has already seen three trips to SE Asia and I love it, roomy, light and durable! It is so lonely sitting under my bed that I feel bad for it.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Waechter

customer_reviews.title: Great travel bag for those one bag travelers...
customer_reviews.text: Just a great travel bag all around. I took this through South America and it was great. It was much bigger than I thought it'd be but I never had any issues taking it onto planes. You just hand to separate the big bag from the little one. The little bag was great for day trips as well. Bag seemed to hold up to the random travel abuse pretty well. I would have liked an extra pouch on the larger bag for organizing things better but overall this bag is great. Definitely recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremiah Fishell

customer_reviews.title: Versatile and well-made
customer_reviews.text: Bought for my son who used it on a trip through Europe for five weeks. It still looks new. He loved the detachable smaller backpack and the way the straps can be tucked in so that the whole thing works like a suitcase. He would definitely use it again in place of a traditional suitcase.
customer_reviews.author: Stefanie  N

customer_reviews.title: The last and only travel back pack you will ever need
customer_reviews.text: Honestly, this bag is awesome. The zippers and lining are incredibly strong and durable. The shape of the bag, adjustable straps and design make walking around as comfortable as can be. I took this bag for 9 days through the Netherlands, Belgium and Germany and it was rock solid. And to ease the mind of those questioning it's airplane carry-on ability; separate the day bag from the main bag and it fits in Delta or Lufthansa planes. My experience anyway. Highly recommend.
customer_reviews.author: Nick R Crowe

customer_reviews.title: Excellent Back Pack!
customer_reviews.text: This is without doubt the most durable and adaptable bag I've ever owned. I used it while circumnavigating Australia, and visits to Fiji and New Zealand for 6 weeks of travel. Some planes it was accepted as carry-on and a few not (some had very small overhead bins). My advice is to get the packing cubes to go with it. Well worth the price.
customer_reviews.author: ted

customer_reviews.title: 2 Weeks through Italy - Perfect Fit
customer_reviews.text: The Farpoint 55 was perfect for my 2 week backpacking adventure through Itaky. Initially I thought it would be too small but was perfect. I was able to travel on trains and toss it in the overhead compartments and the zip away backpack was great for day trips through each city. What I loved about the Farpoint 55 is that you can zip up the straps to make it easier to check-in on a plane. Also the front zip helped tremendously when trying to find stuff. I will be using this bag for all my hiking and travel trips.
customer_reviews.author: FitFellow

customer_reviews.title: Best I've Found
customer_reviews.text: Best traveling backpack I've used so far on a 2 week trip to Zurich, Barcelona, Porto, Dublin, Munich and back home. Wore out a bit on a random spot, don't know if it'll rip or hold up but we will see. Pretty good so far.
customer_reviews.author: HASR

customer_reviews.title: Love this pack!
customer_reviews.text: Great travel backpack. Love the removable day pack. So convenient! Great quality. Good sturdy zippers. Very comfortable.
customer_reviews.author: Sarah Louk

customer_reviews.title: The removable backpack was perfect for our daily outings
customer_reviews.text: We recently took a two week trip to Europe. My husband had this 55L bag and I had a 45L bag. This bag rocked!! The removable backpack was perfect for our daily outings. It fit my large camera plus additional lens, phones, rain coat and more. It has a great laptop case, zipper pocket inside that kept our passport safe, and a good external zipper for little things. The bag itself is large but easy to travel with. My husband fit a great deal of clothes inside (although we did not over pack and wore clothes more than once. Highly recommend this bag!!!
customer_reviews.author: Melissa Green

customer_reviews.title: Best bag ever created 100%
customer_reviews.text: I brought the bag as a carry on for a two day trip and had no issues with carry on. I was even able to fight it under my seat (with the small pack detached, also a tight fit). This pack is great, stop looking and just buy it.
customer_reviews.author: Edgar Escobar

customer_reviews.title: Perfect pack for traveling
customer_reviews.text: This is one of the best backpacks you could possibly get for travel. Our daughter recently went on a school trip to Europe so I purchased this backpack for her and she had plenty of space for all her gear and used the day pack ever single day she was out and about. After her return, my wife and I have used it several times as well and it holds everything we could possible need for short trips. I should point out that my wife and daughter do not pack like most women so that was helpful. :)
customer_reviews.author: Mike's Reviews

customer_reviews.title: Gnarly bag
customer_reviews.text: Took on a trip to Spain and Morocco! It was perfect. Didn’t have to check a bag and stored in a locker in each country and used the smaller bag on tours and traversing the cities.
customer_reviews.author: Dluvsoccer

customer_reviews.title: It fits as a carry on!
customer_reviews.text: My husband and I recently went on a 8 day trip to Italy and didn't want to lug a wheeled suitcase over Venice's bridges, so we just used backpacks. I had the Osprey Fairview 40 and my husband had this one. We were nervous we wouldn't be able to fit his in the carryon, but with a little jiggling, we got it in the Air Canada sizer no problem! I wanted to post these pictures to save someone else days of anxiety over it! It was tight though, and probably would not fit in any of the smaller European airlines sizers.
customer_reviews.author: Pua Hall

customer_reviews.title: Carryon size
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing! My boyfriend and I packed everything we needed for two weeks in Italy in this bag! The best thing, it was still small enough to be an overhead carry on bag! The quality is exceptional, I have another Osprey bag and love them both!
customer_reviews.author: KayT

customer_reviews.title: Just about perfect. Was able to take this on airlines with ...
customer_reviews.text: Just about perfect. Was able to take this on airlines with no problems. Being able to separate the smaller pack is great when you don't need the whole thing. Every feature of this backpack is well thought out and functional. Get some packing cubes to go with it and it's perfect.
customer_reviews.author: Bob B.

customer_reviews.title: Great quality, well thought out
customer_reviews.text: Great size for traveling by train or airplane. Easy to backpack with, once at destination the zip off day pack is perfect for day scrambles
customer_reviews.author: kevin jones

customer_reviews.title: I like how the smaller backpack zips onto the larger backpack
customer_reviews.text: I like how the smaller backpack zips onto the larger backpack. You need to lay the larger one down, on a flat surface, in order to attach the smaller one to it. Makes it hard when you are in the baggage area... there are no flat surfaces at a desk height....so you're stuck with using the floor. My family become impatient with me since it took longer to zip up on the floor vs zipping the bags together at the house (used my kitchen island!). That part of the design needs improvement, but otherwise, love these two bags!!!
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for traveling although you may have to check
customer_reviews.text: This is a great pack! Working for a tech startup I travel a lot with lots of gadgets and batteries, plus my clothes! Having the detachable day pack is a life saver to keep batteries in which I have to carry on. The main pack does "fit" (it's a tight fit and depending on how tightly you packed and the flight staff that day you may have to gate check) within the carry on container when not attached to the day pack so it can be carried on. Zippers are sturdy and great to be able to lock with personal lock.
customer_reviews.author: Kindle Custome

customer_reviews.title: Great pack.
customer_reviews.text: 10 day Italy trip with these bad boys, I preferred to take the day pack off and Sling over my shoulder with the main pack on back. No problem on planes seperated, Really well-made. I hate checking bags and these are perfect. Hip strap system unloads the weight from your shoulders nicely.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great pack for backpacking trip
customer_reviews.text: Awesome backpack for backpacking. Did a 2 week trip across Europe and was able to carry on all budget airlines with no issues. Has plenty of pockets to pack your stuff without fear of getting pickpocketed. Daypack is a bonus on days you don’t want to drag around the whole backpack when exploring around
customer_reviews.author: Xrayguy33

customer_reviews.title: awesome - get it
customer_reviews.text: the backpack is amazing. having a daypack is great, too. it's a little difficult to zip on if your backpack is full to the brim, but i highly recommend this pack. it's light, durable and has tons of space. the fact it opens up and is easy to load is a huge plus. used it several times for travel and it's never let me down.
customer_reviews.author: Scottimus Prime

customer_reviews.title: Bag is awesome
customer_reviews.text: This bag and the travel bag that attaches to it are both awesome. I have used it overseas twice now and it is so convenient, spacious, and functional. The carry-on bag is easily attached and detached to the main bag and when you want to check the main bag, it is easy to hide the backstraps for easy loading. 10/10. Buying a second for my wife. The cost is worth it.
customer_reviews.author: Amanda Wolf

customer_reviews.title: Love this bag so much
customer_reviews.text: Love this bag so much. Took a trip to Malaysia and Thailand for about 13 days, and had no problem using it as a carry-on for multiple flights. I had adequate space and loved the day pack for daily adventuring. The day pack was perfect for a water bottle, phone, and any random souvenirs purchased. It's super cute and very well made.
customer_reviews.author: suzanne williams

customer_reviews.title: They were awesome! They both fit in the carry on compartment ...
customer_reviews.text: I bought two of these for my wife and I. She got the S/M one and I got the M/L one. We used them for a month long trip to Europe. They were awesome! They both fit in the carry on compartment in an aircraft. In fact, I started to use mine for every plane ride. They are so easy to use, pack, and unpack. I love that you can buckle the day bag to the front of your chest when you use the large bag on your back. Its so easy to travel by train or aircraft or any other mode of transportation with this bag. I'd recommend this to anyone.
customer_reviews.author: Kevin D.

customer_reviews.title: Great purchase
customer_reviews.text: Sturdy and great quality. When I go on short trips or trips where I don't have a car, this is very useful. Its easy to get up and go. I put my shoes on the bottom and can easily stack everything else. I like the smaller backpack for day trips. My husband liked this so much he bought one.
customer_reviews.author: EE

customer_reviews.title: The front pack easily zips on and off for airplane carry on or ...
customer_reviews.text: Just took this on a week long trip to Iceland. The front pack easily zips on and off for airplane carry on or day pack. Easy to access everything inside. Holds a high volume of clothes, hiking shoes, hair dryer, toiletries, enough for 8 days. It even has a laptop compartment. A place for everything. Fits well, not unwieldy. It's the perfect traveler. And significant discount over the recreation outlet company that I love so much.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Best bag EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I’m faithful to few brands but I will NEVER own another brand of bags in my life. Osprey has thought out every little detail, I absolutely love this bag. So much so that I just bought two of their backpacking backpacks as well.
customer_reviews.author: NateHoward

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for Travel
customer_reviews.text: I purchased two of these for our trip to Peru. This packed worked great! It fits in the overhead bin of the plane with or without the small pack attached. The smaller pack made for a great day pack for shorter excursions and overnights. It even fit my water bladder perfectly. Would suggest you add a colorful survival bracelet (which we did) on the handle to identify it from other travelers as this is a popular pack.
customer_reviews.author: Cat

customer_reviews.title: Couldn't be happier with it
customer_reviews.text: Just used this on a two week trip to the UK. Couldn't be happier with it. It also was allowed on both flights using British Airways. I used the packing cubes for my clothes and toiletries.
customer_reviews.author: Dennis Grube

customer_reviews.title: After trying several Backpacks I fell in love with this one
customer_reviews.text: I wanted something I could use as a Go Bag. After trying several Backpacks I fell in love with this one. It has a Wide Open Main Compartment, and the Smaller outer Backpack is removable, you can wear it on your front for easy access to items, and the Main on your back. This one is worth looking at, and is well worth the money at $179.00 I used my credit card rewards to help pay for it and it ended up costing me $54.00 Now that's a deal.
customer_reviews.author: BJ Fink

customer_reviews.title: Awesome backpack!
customer_reviews.text: I took this backpack on my trip to southeast asia. Went to 4 different countries with this backpack and absolutely loved it. It was comfortable on my shoulders and back and had plenty of room for clothes and other necessities. The attachable smaller backpack was great for when I went out on walks in the cities. A must buy for travelers!
customer_reviews.author: Mohsin

customer_reviews.title: Great backpack
customer_reviews.text: Great backpack for travelling. At first glance, I thought it wouldn't hold a lot but surprisingly it holds a great deal. I travelled to multiple countries with this as my carry-on back to the brim! Very comfortable on body.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Good for Hiking and Short trips, Not for longer one's especially if your plus sized.
customer_reviews.text: It's a really awesome bag. I bought it for over seas travel and realized that it would be too small for me sadly. Being plus size, my clothing is bigger so i couldn't fit 4 weeks worth of stuff in it. I have found out it is GREAT for shorter trips that are 3-5 days long, 7 if I'm using Air BNB and my place has a washing machine.
customer_reviews.author: JustACreative

customer_reviews.title: Perfect travel pack
customer_reviews.text: Wife and I bought the same pack for a 2 week backpacking trip in Thailand. They were perfect. No problems with it as a carry on during the flights over. They were packed to the max on the way back so we checked the main packs. Mainly because of the weight. "Turtling" is the best way to use them to balance the weight.
customer_reviews.author: Michigander033

customer_reviews.title: We love our farpoint 55s
customer_reviews.text: We love our farpoint 55s! We own two and our family of 4 can easily pack into the two of them for a long weekend, or even a week away in the summer time. After using these a couple of times we sold the rest of our luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Jeremy Brown

customer_reviews.title: A+ backpack for women traveler
customer_reviews.text: I highly recommend this backpack fro traveling. I purchased it for my trip to south east asia and it was a hit. I was able to carry it onboard as a carry on on all my flight, train and bus trips. Both backpacks have double zippers to add locks. The smaller backpack is great for daily activities and hiking. I am 5,5 and this backpack was perfect size for me. A+
customer_reviews.author: Tamara

customer_reviews.title: Strong and stealthy
customer_reviews.text: Absolutely fantastic backpack! It fits the body well, carries so much, and went through TSA/airline baggage checks easily. No one even questioned that I had this enormous bag. Plus it fits so easily into the overhead bins so never an issue even in a packed flight.
customer_reviews.author: Meet Patel

customer_reviews.title: Great for Europe
customer_reviews.text: Took this on a 10 day trip to Europe and it held up great! Checked it on multiple flights with no issues (thanks to the zip away straps). Having the day pack zip off was great for a carry on with essentials. Definitely easier on the cobblestone streets of Florence than a rolling luggage.
customer_reviews.author: Mike L.Top Contributor: Pets

customer_reviews.title: Excellent product.
customer_reviews.text: It's a excellent backpack. It adjust perfectly to the body (needs some time to set the straps). Easy to oganize items for the trip, the only problem is that the exterior is not so resistent against abrasion. So, if you will not carry on the bag, it may have some damage.
customer_reviews.author: Thiago Maciel dos Santos

customer_reviews.title: Fantastic pack!
customer_reviews.text: I love this backpack. I use the large part as a carry on and the backpack as a personal item. I used this pack to go backpacking in Europe, it was perfect. I love that it looks a lot nicer than most backpacking packs so it fits in a little better in a city setting. I use the smaller backpack part all the time, my 15" laptop fits snugly in the back pocket.
customer_reviews.author: palindromegnome

customer_reviews.title: 11/29/17 Haven't used it yet but material looks very good, it's spacious
customer_reviews.text: 11/29/17 Haven't used it yet but material looks very good, it's spacious. The only thing is i couldn't use it as a carry on for one of my flights. That's why i haven't been able to use it. Will try with another airline and will update.
customer_reviews.author: AG

customer_reviews.title: Perfect
customer_reviews.text: Couldn't be more in love with my bag. Have taken it on more than one extended summer European trip with it now.
customer_reviews.author: Tim Huffman

customer_reviews.title: Great bag
customer_reviews.text: This bag is amazing. I am 5 feet tall so I got the s/m size for our 3-month trip to Asia. No problems at all. It was able to carry all of my things with no issues (but that is really dependent on who is packing it, of course) I love the removable daypack and the fact that the straps can be zipped up while in transit. I also love the wide access point that can be locked up if need be. All in all, really satisfied with the product.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Great Travel Backpack
customer_reviews.text: Wow what an amazing backpack!! Just got this for my 18 day trip to Europe. Nobody could believe I pulled of this trip with just these 2 backpacks, managed to keep it under 30 lbs. Didn’t plan on getting any souvenirs but people bought me some for my birthday and I got a sweater for my son. It was tight but still managed to fit it all. I highly recommend this backpack.
customer_reviews.author: Christopher Hyde

customer_reviews.title: Where have you been all my life?
customer_reviews.text: After much reviewing of "best travel backpack" sites, I decided on this one. Best decision. The zippers are super strong. Thoughtful construction with the clips and straps. It fits comfortably (I'm 5'6" and average build female) and the waist strap is so helpful to better distribute the weight. My only wish is that the day pack had more zippered compartments inside or outside; I like to organize a bit more than throw everything in a crap sack.
customer_reviews.author: cjeffrun27

customer_reviews.title: Just OK
customer_reviews.text: Took weeks to arrive. Thank God I ordered months ahead of time. Quality is OK, but the pulltabs on all the zippers are made of cheap plastic. If someone were using these to anchor locks, they would be very easy to snip or break.
customer_reviews.author: Lisa Maari

customer_reviews.title: Great for travel
customer_reviews.text: Perfect backpack for traveling internationally. Comfortable, great size. The day pack that comes of is great for day excursions.
customer_reviews.author: Janelle C.

customer_reviews.title: ... weeks of travel in Europe this summer - worked great! I wish there were more pockets though
customer_reviews.text: used it for 2 weeks of travel in Europe this summer - worked great! I wish there were more pockets though!! There is only one inside to separate the large compartment. also a pock for a water bottle on the outside or even a small zipper for phone/credit cards around the waist strap would have been very handy. Overall pleased
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Asia trip, here we come!
customer_reviews.text: A bit bigger than expected but I was not at all disappointed. The day pack will come very handy on our upcoming trip to Asia!
customer_reviews.author: Siegfred

customer_reviews.title: my ride or die
customer_reviews.text: I'e trekked through 4 different countries with this pack and have loved every minute.
customer_reviews.author: Dr. P

customer_reviews.title: Travel all throughout Europe no problem. Checked a bag ...
customer_reviews.text: Travel all throughout Europe no problem. Checked a bag on regional flights... but they required almost everyone to check. Held up really well. One downside is the non-secure water bottle holder... I used a caravener to secure.
customer_reviews.author: B

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for a two week trip to Thailand
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for a two week trip to Thailand. Held all necessities. Packed 6 outfits, toiletries, extra pair of shoes with room to bring back souvenirs!
customer_reviews.author: Allison M.

customer_reviews.title: Osprey to the rescue!
customer_reviews.text: Bought this for my dad to take on our 2 week, European vacation. A bit small for MY liking (this girl likes to PACK), but perfect for my dad, the minimalist.
customer_reviews.author: C. Herrera

customer_reviews.title: Nice pack for carryon travel.
customer_reviews.text: Traveled as carryon with no problem. Detached day pack and carried separate.
customer_reviews.author: Lou

customer_reviews.title: Osprey Pack is a perfect fit
customer_reviews.text: Bought this as a gift for my son who will use it in Europe this summer. It's a perfect size for a weeks worth of treking. Suspension system fits perfectly. This is the M/L size and both my son & I are 5'8" tall. The ability to take off the day pack was a major factor in my decision to purchase this model for him as he will need a daypack while venturing out from his home base.
customer_reviews.author: Dov Neidish

customer_reviews.title: Really excited about this backpack!
customer_reviews.text: As soon as I opened the box any lingering doubts were totally vaporized. The backpack looks amazing, fits a ridiculous amount of stuff and has a great frame that makes it comfortable to wear loaded. The detachable pack is cooler than it looks in photos. The pack has a simple single main pocket with an internal sleeve on the inside of the front cover and the detachable pack has a small outer pocket and a laptop sleeve.
customer_reviews.author: Kayama57

customer_reviews.title: this is AWESOME
customer_reviews.text: this is AWESOME great for travel abroad, sure it would be good for the woods too. I like that it doesn't have a million straps hanging down from it like my old school hiking pack. love the day pack too.
customer_reviews.author: LowCo Suzuki Guitar

product_meta.title: Osprey Farpoint 55 Men's Travel Backpack
product_meta.description: Osprey’s Farpoint 55 is the perfect companion for a long weekend. Feel free to add an extra sweater and a pair of waterproof boots; this pack is designed to handle loads up to 50 pounds. The LightWire frame suspension transfers the load from harness to hipbelt. A mesh backpanel improves ventilation and the mesh on the harness and hipbelt reduces chafing under load. The entire suspension stows away under a zippered panel creating a sleek silhouette for transport. Inside there’s a mesh pocket for small items. Dual compression straps keep cargo from shifting during transit. Outside you’ll find a zippered front panel slash pocket to keep you organized and sewn attachment points to lash on extra gear. The main Farpoint 55 pack comes with a detachable Farpoint daypack to carry the essential for a hike in the hills or an excursion downtown. No matter where you go, the Farpoint is backed by Osprey's All Mighty Guarantee.
feature_bullets: Large, lockable U-zip duffel-style access to main compartment - 55L total volume
Detachable daypack with designated laptop and tablet sleeve and scratch-free stash pocket
Stowaway backpanel, shoulder straps and hipbelt with zippered rear flap for protection when checking
Lockable zipper access to padded laptop & tablet sleeve (fits up to most 15" laptops)
Lockable sliders on main compartment zipper
Scratch-free pocket for sunglasses or devices

Average customer reviews has a small extra line on hover* https://omni-grok.amazon.com/xref/src/appgroup/websiteTemplates/retail/SoftlinesDetailPageAssets/udp-intl-lock/src/legacy.css?indexName=WebsiteTemplates#40*/.noUnderline a:hover {text-decoration: none;}
